Sentencas: For planar SOFCs the seal is a critical component, potential fracture in the seal needs to be investigated in order to enhance the reliability or the seal, A model based on the classical beam bending theory and the fracture theory of ceramic materials has been developed for predicting the crack extension in the seal.
Titulo: Modeling of cracking of the glass-based seals for solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The model reveals that the resistance of the seal to cracking on cooling is mainly affected by two factors: the seal thickness and the CTE mismatch.
Titulo: Modeling of cracking of the glass-based seals for solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Furthermore, a cracking diagram is established to reveal the effects of the seal thickness and CTE mismatch on the crack extension behavior.
Titulo: Modeling of cracking of the glass-based seals for solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: It shows that the 'no cracking' area increases with decreasing seal thickness, and larger CTE mismatch requires a thinner seal to avoid cracking.
Titulo: Modeling of cracking of the glass-based seals for solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The model and the cracking diagram are experimentally validated through monitoring the leakage rate of a glass-sealed chamber.
Titulo: Modeling of cracking of the glass-based seals for solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: and the crack extension deduced from the measured leakage rate shows good agreement with those predicted by the model.
Titulo: Modeling of cracking of the glass-based seals for solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The proposed model can serve as a useful tool in sealing design of SOFC.
Titulo: Modeling of cracking of the glass-based seals for solid oxide fuel cell

Titulo: Modeling of cracking of the glass-based seals for solid oxide fuel cell
